newsitem.title: DUBAI: PRESS DIGEST - United Arab Emirates - April 24.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - United Arab Emirates - April 24.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the United Arab Emirates press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Saudi Basic Industries Corp (SABIC) tops a report of the Middle East's top 500 companies, with the United Arab Emirates telecommunications company Etisalat coming in second. The report is published by the Middle East Economic Digest.
- UAE telecommunications company Etisalat on Wednesday reported net profits of 1.7 billion dirhams for 1996 from 1.4 billion in 1995.

- The level of illegal oil discharges along the Oman coast was worse in the winter of 1996-97 than at any time during the past 15 years, an Omani environmental official told a conference in Manama on Wednesday.

- UAE investors are racing to subscribe in the world's biggest Islamic bank in terms of capital, the Emirates Islamic Bank, which will be based in Abu Dhabi and partly owned by the UAE government. Media reports said the bank would have paid-in capital of 1.2 billion dirhams and an authorised capital of three billion Saudi riyals.
- Union Properties announced a net profit of 14.6 million dirhams for 1996, down from 17.8 million in 1995.
- Lufthansa will increase its Middle East service in the summer timetable, raising to three the number of weekly flights from Frankfurt to Abu Dhabi.
- Etisalat said at its annual general meeting it had raised its capital to 2.3 billion dirhams from 1.86 billion after its one-for-four bonus share issue.
